ovdesc.p: The charge override property class is used to waive or negotiate any adhoc charges triggered for an activity. i.e When an activity collects a activity charges or periodic charges this property class is automatically added to the properties tab so that user can negotiate the charge amount collected by the system.

When a rule is broken what action needs to be taken is defined here. Currently, the various options available are
Error block further processing
Override Give an override

FLOOR the rule value is to be used as a FLOOR if the rule is broken

No input and multi value field lists all fields that have been negotiated for each dated version of the property. For a subsequently dated property, the attributes listed in this field will appear in "Negotiated.Fields" and only newly negotiated fields will appear on "Changed.Fields"
The waived charge amount which is to be collected.
Eg:
Consider an activity 'LENDING-INCREASE-TERMAMOUNT' when triggered collects an charge of 500 USD.

Being a privilege customer to the bank, the bank decides to waive the charge amount of 500 USD to 250 USD. This 250 USD is specified in this field so that Bills and accounting entries are raised for this charge amount.

The actual charge amount which is computed by the system. It is not necessary that the user should input this field. This is automatically populated when an activity charge or periodic charge is calculated by the system.
Eg:
Consider an activity 'LENDING-INCREASE-TERMAMOUNT' when triggered collects an charge of 500 USD.
This 500 USD is defined in this field.
Description about why the charge has been negotiated when triggering the activity.
This field specifies what type of charge is being collected. This is also automatically populated by the system depending upon the charge calculated.
It can accept 2 values 'ACT.CHARGE' - Activity Charge; 'PR.CHARGE' - Periodic Charge.
p>Optional field - Allowed Values are RESETTING and NON-RESETTING.
RESETTING - During any Renewal Activities (for eg : change.product, rollover or reset) the property conditions will be reset from the product.
NON-RESETTING - During any Renewal Activities property conditions will be maintained from the Arrangement level.
Not used in Arrangement/Sim level.
Leaving the field blank sets NON-RESETTING as the default option.
